articles.title: Russian FM Arrives
articles.content:
Russian FM Arrives
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, foreign minister of the Russian Federation, and his party arrived here today.
					 They were greeted at the airport by Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK and Russian FMs
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK and Russian FMs
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, and Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, foreign minister of the Russian Federation, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were officials concerned and from the Russian side Lavrov's party and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on developing the relations between the two countries and a series of matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Plan of Cultural and Scientific Exchange between DPRK and Russian Governments Signed
articles.content:
Plan of Cultural and Scientific Exchange between DPRK and Russian Governments Signed
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- A 2009-2010 plan of cultural and scientific exchange between the governments of the DPRK and Russia was signed in Pyongyang on Thursday. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned and from the Russian side Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, foreign minister of the Russian Federation, and his party and Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 It was inked by Mun Jae Chol and Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov.

articles.title: Russian FM Visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Russian FM Visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, foreign minister of the Russian Federation, and his party visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Thursday to pay their respects to President Kim Il Sung.
					 The guests made bows in boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung who made undying contributions to the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and Russia and the global independence.
					
					  The foreign minister wrote in the visitor's book that he paid homage to President Kim Il Sung, an outstanding state activist and the founder of the DPRK, adding that the President would always be remembered by the Russian people as a resolute defender of friendship and cooperation between the two countries and two peoples.

articles.title: Russian Foreign Minister Lays Wreath before Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Foreign Minister Lays Wreath before Liberation Tower
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, foreign minister of the Russian Federation, laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower Thursday.
					 Attending the wreath-laying ceremony were the Russian foreign minister's party and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 A wreath was laid before the tower in the name of the foreign minister.
					
					 The participants paid a silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the soviet army before looking round the tower.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday met a delegation of Koreans in Japan led by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, and had a compatriotic conversation at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Korean Revolution Museum Visited by Diplomatic Envoys
articles.content:
Korean Revolution Museum Visited by Diplomatic Envoys
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here visited the Korean Revolution Museum Thursday on the occasion of the 77th anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army. 
					 Being briefed on the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in founding the Juche-based revolutionary armed forces and leading the arduous anti-Japanese war to victory, the corps looked round photo documents, historical relics and materials on display. 
					
					 At the end of the visit Wang Zhilin, economic and commercial councilor of the Chinese embassy, wrote in the visitor's book that the Korean people have accomplished the historic cause of liberating the country with strenuous efforts, under the leadership of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He added that he wished the Korean people fresh success in their drive for building a thriving nation under the Songun politics.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Family of Zhang Weihua
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Family of Zhang Weihua
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by the family of Zhang Weihua, anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr of China, on Thursday on the occasion of the 77th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army. 
					 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were letters "We Wholeheartedly Wish the Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Good Health".

articles.title: Floral Basket Presented to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Presented to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il from Jong Il Sim, Korean in Russia, on a visit to the homeland Thursday on the occasion of the 77th anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army.
					 It was handed to an official concerned.

articles.title: Russian Forestry Delegation Here
articles.content:
Russian Forestry Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- A forestry delegation of Russia led by Ivan Matsorov, vice-minister of Industry and Commerce, arrived here today to participate in the 13th meeting of the forestry subcommittee of the trade, economic and scientific and technical cooperative committee between the governments of the DPRK and Russia.

articles.title: Yonggwang Furniture Enjoy Popularity
articles.content:
Yonggwang Furniture Enjoy Popularity
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Products of the Yonggwang Furniture Joint Venture Company of the DPRK are popular at home and abroad.
					 Varied in style and assortment and durable in materials, they are well received by the users for their very high level of standardization, specification and specialization.
					
					 Diverse styles of such household goods as conference tables, wall cabinets, beds, sofas and TV tables and kitchen utensils including wooden cupboards, sink frames and dining tables are quite presentable. They are not only handy but also very durable under natural conditions.
					
					 A rich selection of chairs made of oak and black walnut trees look peculiar in patterns and color and superb in quality, while retaining natural beauty.  They are regarded as necessaries indispensable at theatres, hotels and other establishments.
					
					 Doors made of quality wood and multipurpose folding furniture have recently been developed to attract the interest of the customers.

articles.title: Historic Conference for Great National Unity
articles.content:
Historic Conference for Great National Unity
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean people with deep emotion are looking back upon the undying feats performed by President      Kim Il Sung who devoted his whole life to the national unity and reunification and provided a solid foundation for realizing the cause of the independent reunification on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the historic Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Public Organizations in North and South Korea. 
					The conference was held in Pyongyang from April 19 to 23, Juche 37 (1948) on the initiative of the President and under his guidance. It was a historic nation-wide meeting for achieving the great national unity under the banner of reunification and patriotism and saving the destiny of the country and the nation.
					
					At that time the U.S. imperialists who had occupied south Korea by force of arms and their lackeys laid an obstacle on the way of the Korean people  for the building of a sovereign and independent state with the treacherous scheme to fabricate "separate elections and government" there.
					
					The President with a penetration into the prevailing situation convened the conference for the purpose of bridging over the crisis and building an independent reunified country by dint of the great national unity.
					
					At the conference the President set forth it as the most important political task for the Korean nation to foil the "separate elections and government" scheme in south Korea and to establish a unified democratic government so as to reunify the country. And he advanced the policy of rallying all the Koreans, who were concerned about the destiny of the country and the nation, irrespective of party grouping, affiliation and political opinion.
					
					He stressed that all the patriotic forces should be rallied to frustrate the aggressive attempt of the U.S. imperialists without fail, noting that only unity could ensure victory.
					
					It is a fine fruition of the President's independent policy of national reunification, idea of great national unity and great all-embracing politics that representatives from most of the political parties and public organizations and even obstinate anti-communist nationalists gathered together in the broad national meeting for discussing important affairs of the nation except a handful of traitors to the nation under so complex situation right after the liberation and reached a unanimous agreement to wage a nation-wide anti-U.S. struggle.
					
					With President Kim Il Sung's outstanding idea of great national unity and exploits he performed throughout his life as precious heritage, the Korean people, under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, will certainly accomplish the cause of national reunification, holding aloft the banner of the "By our nation itself".

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Actions Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Actions Flailed
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the south Korean fascist authorities walked away to a police station eight persons affiliated to the Confederation of Trade Unions, charging that the "general voting of trade unionists" conducted by the confederation with the approach of the "by-election of National Assemblymen" was in violation of the "law on election". In another development, they arrested dozens of youth and students who attended a "hair-cutting ceremony of university student representatives" demanding a solution to the issues of registration fee and young unemployed on charges of violation of the "law on assembly and demonstration".
					 These repressive rackets are the hideous fascist actions which can be perpetrated only by the Lee Myung Bak "government" ill-famed for its serious human rights abuses and pragmatic dictatorship, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The activities conducted by the progressive forces and the patriotic people for the democratic development of society and the right to existence against the unpopular rule of the south Korean authorities can never be targets of suppression as they are quite just and natural.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the Lee group is arresting guiltless people, treating them as criminals. This is an unpardonable criminal action to render all fabrics of society strictly fascist in favor of its dictatorial rule in gross violation of people's elementary democratic freedom and rights and the right to existence. 
					
					 The Lee group is a junta of the worst fascist gangsters putting the successive military dictators into the shade as it has trampled down upon people's elementary right to existence and democratic freedom with violence in order to prop up its treacherous rule and tide over its ruling crisis. 
					
					 The Lee regime has not brought any benefit to the south Korean people but dashed even their desire for national reunification, to say nothing of national dignity and rights and democracy. 
					
					 The intensified suppression by the south Korean authorities would get them nowhere. 
					
					 The history and the nation have already sentenced the Lee regime to death penalty.
					
					 This is clearly exemplified by the strong voices of various social circles and the people of broad strata in south Korea demanding the regime step down.
					
					 The ferocious fascist dictators will be forced to stand the trial of history any time for betraying the nation quite contrary to the trend of the times.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks Flayed
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak was recently reported to have met Japanese Prime Minister Aso two days after the Japanese government passed the distorted historic textbook through its screening. At the meeting Lee should have protested against this but let loose a spate of rubbish that south Korea-Japan relations wavered due to the issue of understanding history but should not be allowed to retreat" and "these relations should be developed in a future-oriented manner".
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Thursday observes: 
					
					These are no more than treacherous remarks as they meant telling the Japanese reactionaries not to worry even a bit as south Korea would not take issue with their distortion of history though they are rushing headlong into overseas expansion, whitewashing the blood-stained history of the crimes committed by Japan against the Koreans.
					
					 Citing facts to prove the acts of treachery perpetrated by Lee to serve Japan since he seized power, the news analyst says: Born in Osaka of Japan, he is a top-class pro-Japanese stooge who had not only his umbilical cord but his soul buried in Osaka. 
					
					 Having this pro-Japanese lackey in the south Korean presidency, the Japanese reactionaries are getting more frantic with their moves to tamper with the history and grab Tok Islet in a desperate bid to stage a comeback to Korea and restore their old position as a colonial ruler.
					
					 It is the way of holding in check the moves of Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, for reinvasion and forcing it to pay for its past crimes a thousand times for the Koreans to wage an anti- Lee Myung Bak struggle, concludes the news analyst.

articles.title: Large-scale Anti-"Government" Struggle Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Large-scale Anti-"Government" Struggle Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- At least 500 civic and public organizations of south Korea including the People's Council for Livelihood and Democracy held a press conference in Seoul on April 20 at which they said that the people from all walks of life would solidarize with each other in the large-scale struggle to judge the Lee Myung Bak regime with May Day as a momentum.
					 At the press conference speakers deplored that the people's living has been deteriorated and democracy ruthlessly trampled down in south Korea since Lee Myung Bak came to power. 
					
					 Now is the time for the people from all walks of life, to say nothing of workers, peasants, youth and students, to pool their efforts, they said, underlining the need to hold an all-people meeting with more than 100,000 people of all social standings attending on May Day and thus intensify the struggle against the unpopular policy of the Lee Myung Bak regime.
					
					 This struggle will continue till the anniversary of the June 10 resistance, they said, calling upon all the people in different parts of south Korea to turn out in the struggle to force the traitorous regime to step down.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Stamp out Democracy Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Stamp out Democracy Blasted
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- University professors and researchers from across south Korea under the Professors Trade Union, the Council of Professors for Democracy and the Council of Academic Organizations on April 19 published a declaration on the situation denouncing traitor Lee Myung Bak's moves to stamp out democracy. 
					 The declaration recalled that the participants in the April 19 uprising laid down their lives for social democracy in resistance against the Syngman Rhee dictatorial regime.
					
					  Democracy has been ruthlessly trampled down in this land due to the undemocratic violence by the Lee Myung Bak regime, it noted, adding that for the more than one year since the emergence of the present regime it has committed countless high-handed and arbitrary practices.
					
					 It held that only when all the democratic forces struggle in firm unity can they put an end to the repressive rule of the present regime and protect the people's democratic rights and vital rights.
					
					 It stressed that university professors and researchers would wage a widespread campaign for exposing and denouncing the undemocratic atrocities of the Lee Myung Bak regime and boost the solidarity and unity with the organizations representing people of all strata.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to the DPRK embassies in Cairo and Addis Ababa on April 14 by the vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, the vice-chairman of the Veterans Committee of Egypt, the chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association and the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Damascus
articles.content:
Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Damascus
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Syria Hassan Turkmani who is minister of Defence sent a large floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Damascus on April 16 congratulating General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his reelection as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.

articles.title: UNSC "Presidential Statement" Refuted
articles.content:
UNSC "Presidential Statement" Refuted
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea released a statement on April 15 denouncing the "presidential statement" faked up by the UNSC.
					 Recalling that recently the UNSC adopted the "presidential statement" by branding the DPRK's satellite launch as a "missile launch", the statement said that this breached the spirit of the UN Charter as it is another discrimination of the UNSC against the DPRK.
					
					 It said that the UNSC is escalating the regional tension by keeping the nuclear hegemonic position of big powers and making only the interests of such countries as Japan absolute under the manipulation of the United States, far from giving a helping hand to the reunification and social economic development of Korea and the realization of the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The International Liaison Committee holds that the UNSC whose legitimacy was lost should be reformed, the statement said, stressing that the "presidential statement" of the UNSC carries no binding force and UN member nations have no legal duty to implement it.
					
					 On the same day the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association issued a statement at which it denounced the UNSC's adoption of "presidential statement" as a crime of challenging the DPRK's independent right to conduct the space development for peaceful purposes and an act contrary to the outer space treaty.

articles.title: International Community Reveres Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
International Community Reveres Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu
Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- An opening ceremony of the Kimilsungia Greenhouse was held with splendour in Guinea on the occasion of the Day of the Sun this year.
					This is a token of the aspiration of the world progressives to shine an august name of President Kim Il Sung and his immortal feats.
					
					Since the Kim Il Sung Cell was formed in Costa Rica in Juche 34 (1945), units and organizations of many countries were named after the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					Streets, libraries, classrooms, kindergartens, memorial rooms of reading, institutes of agricultural science and others named after the President have made their appearances one after another in different countries including China, Cuba, Mongolia, Bulgaria, Belarus, Uganda and Tanzania.
					
					In April 1965 when the President visited Indonesia, the Indonesian president showed a special flower newly bred in his country to the President and called it Kimilsungia.
					
					In February 1988 a horticulturist of Japan named a rare flower Kimjongilia, that he had bred at the end of 20-odd-year long laborious researches, and presented it to General Secretary Kim Jong Il. It was a historic event which informed the world of the breeding of the flower of the sun named after another peerlessly great man.
					
					The first Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung was organized in Mali in April 1969 reflecting the aspiration and enthusiasm of the world progressive people to study the great Juche idea created by the President. Since then units and organizations named after the President such as group for the study of works, youth group for the study of works, study committees and study societies have been formed in India, Japan, Pakistan, Mexico, Peru and other countries, whose number is on a steady increase.
					
					An ardent aspiration of the world progressives to give his august name to their organizations remains unchanged even after his demise. An agricultural college is called Kim Il Sung Agricultural College and a street Generalissimo Kim Il Sung Street. Besides, recollection committees and friendship organizations including the Nepalese National Memorial Committee for the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung have been organized in various countries.
					
					The greatness of Kim Jong Il's idea and leadership has produced many societies for study of his works, groups for study of the Juche idea and units named after him in Russia, India, Ukraine, Nigeria and other countries of the world. Among them are the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il's Works, the National Liaison Council of the Japan Society for Study of Kim Jong Il's Works, Kim Jong Il Classrooms and Kim Jong Il Libraries.
					
					The progressive people of the world are also naming their units and organizations after anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					
					Recent years witnessed that many organizations of the world have been given her august name one after another, including the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk and the Russian Women's Union in the Title of Kim Jong Suk.
					
					There are some units and organizations named the august names of the peerlessly great men such as the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of  Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il in Vienna, Austria and the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il E-Library of Philippines－DPRK Friendship Society.
					
					The "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council was formed with prominent figures of political, social and scholar circles of the world in April 1993 to award the prize. The International Kim Il Sung Foundation was founded by the positive efforts of the world progressive people including the chairman of the Global Group of Britain in October 2007 and monuments "Protectors of Arts for the Century" in which the names of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are engraved were erected in various cities of Russia. All the facts glaringly show the ardent reverence for the peerlessly great men and woman.

articles.title: Special Bulletins Published to Commemorate Day of Sun
articles.content:
Special Bulletins Published to Commemorate Day of Sun
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Kuwait and Sri Lanka issued special bulletins on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 The Kuwaiti preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and the Kuwait-Korea Friendship Association jointly issued a special bulletin on April 12.
					
					 In an article titled " Kim Il Sung, founder of the state, Korea" the bulletin highly praised President Kim Il Sung as the founder of the state who built the DPRK, a socialist power.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, the DPRK is dynamically advancing toward a new higher goal for building a great prosperous and powerful nation, the bulletin noted, stressing that the feats performed by Kim Il Sung in the state building will shine long with the eternal prosperity of socialist Korea.
					
					 The Sri Lanka-People's Korea Friendship Association issued bulletin "Juche Korea" on April 11. The bulletin carried an article entitled "Human cause of independence and President Kim Il Sung" praising the undying feats performed by the President not only for the Korean revolution but also for global independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Peru
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" was brought out in booklet by the P.P. Publishing House of Peru on April 14.
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 84 (1995), clarifies the idea that ideology should be adhered to and priority given to ideological work over anything else to successfully accomplish socialism, the basic task of ideological work is to colour the whole of society with socialist ideology and ideological work must be carried out in accordance with principles and methods which meet the intrinsic requirements of socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de la familia de Zhang Weihua
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de la familia de Zhang Weihua
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio el dia 23 un cesto de flores que le enviara la familia del martir revolucionario antijapones chino, Zhang Weihua, con motivo del 77o aniversario de la fundacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					  En la cinta del cesto se leia: "Deseamos de todo corazon la buena salud al gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il".

articles.title: Entidades de varios paises denuncian "declaracion presidencial" del CS
articles.content:
Entidades de varios paises denuncian "declaracion presidencial" del CS
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- La presidencia del Comite Internacional de Enlace por la Reunificacion y la Paz en Corea (CIERECO) publico el dia 15 una declaracion condenando la "declaracion presidencial" fabricada por el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					  Hace poco, el CS de la ONU aprobo la llamada "declaracion presidencial" calificando el lanzamiento del satelite artificial de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea como "el de misil", senala la nota y anade que esto es otro acto discriminatorio de ese aparato de la ONU sobre la RPDC y una violacion al espiritu de la Carta de la ONU.
					
					  En lugar de contribuir a la reunificacion, el desarrollo socio-economico de Corea y a la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, el CS mantiene bajo la manipulacion  de EE.UU. la posicion monopolista de las potencias en el campo nuclear y agrava la tension regional defendiendo absolutamente los intereses de algunos paises como Japon, critica.
					
					  El CIERECO piensa que debe ser reformado el CS que perdio la legitimidad, subraya y continua que la "declaracion presidencial" del CS no es restrictiva y los paises miembros de la ONU tampoco tienen ninguna obligacion legal de ejecutarla.
					
					  El mismo dia, la Asociacion de Amistad India-Corea de toda la India publico una declaracion tildando el referido documento del Consejo de Seguridad de crimen desafiante al derecho soberano de Corea, que realiza el desarrollo espacial pacifico, y de acto contraproducente con el tratado del cosmos.

articles.title: Agregados militares visitan el barco espia armado "Pueblo"
articles.content:
Agregados militares visitan el barco espia armado "Pueblo"
  Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 77o aniversario de la fundacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el Cuerpo de Agregados Militares en Corea recorrio el dia 22 el barco espia armado norteamericano "Pueblo".
					 Ellos pasaron revista a las armas y equipos de espionaje como el arsenal, la sala de sintesis de informaciones, la sala de desciframiento, la ametralladora del calibre de 12.7 mm y la antena de alta eficiencia escuchando explicaciones de como fue capturado, segun la medida de autodefensa de las fuerzas navales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, ese barco de espias armados norteamericanos que se dedicaba al espionaje en las profundidades de las aguas jurisdiccionales de Corea.
					
					 Terminada la visita, el agregado militar cubano, Miguel Angel Gala Valiente, quien preside el citado cuerpo, escribio en el libro de visitas que bajo la sabia direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el heroico EPC mostro plenamente su poderio manteniendose siempre en la perfecta disposicion de combate.
					
					  Prosiguio que el EPC comandado por el General Kim Jong Il lograria solo las victorias y envio el saludo combativo a los oficiales y soldados del EPC que acogeran pronto el dia de fundacion de su ejercito.

articles.title: Minju Joson insiste en eliminar al traidor projapones Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson insiste en eliminar al traidor projapones Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 23 de abril (ATCC) -- Segun trascendidos, al reunirse con el premier japones Aso dos dias despues de que el gobierno japones aprobara el tergiversado manual de la historia, el traidor Lee Myung Bak, lejos de protestarlo, hablo de que las "relaciones bilaterales no retrocederan por el problema de la comprension de la historia aunque hubo casos del paro momentaneo" y "hay que desarrollarlas en direccion al futuro".
					  Tal conducta antinacional estimula a los reaccionarios japoneses, que describen como positiva la historia de crimenes manchados de la sangre de la nacion coreana y avanzan por la senda de expansionismo a ultramar, insinuandoles que no se preocupen nada del problema de tergiversacion de la historia.
					
					  Al respecto, el rotativo Minju Joson divulgo este jueves un comentario individual. 
					
					  Tras revelar con datos los actos projaponeses de Lee Myung Bak registrados despues de su toma de posesion, el comentarista califico a ese tipejo nacido en Osaka de Japon de traidor projapones de pesima calana que dejo hasta su espiritu nacional en su tierra natal.
					
					 Debido a ese traidor servil a Japon que fanfarrea como "presidente", los reaccionarios japoneses proceden con mas arrogancia a la tergiversacion de la historia y a la maniobra para arrebatar la isla Tok y actuan imprudentemente para ocupar otra vez su antigua posicion de metropoli esgrimiendo el sable para la nueva agresion, denuncio.
					
					  Toda la nacion coreana debe desplegar la lucha anti-Lee Myung Bak por detener las maniobras de nueva agresion de Japon, enemigo jurado, y cobrar mil veces el precio de los crimenes cometidos por este pais en el siglo pasado contra el pueblo coreano, subrayo.
